p: We included nasopharyngeal swab (123/162, 75.9%), bronchoalveolar lavage (17/162, 10.5%), bronchoaspirate (12/162, 7.4%) and sputum (10/162, 6.2%) samples. SARS-CoV-2 RNA was detected in 56 (34.6%) of 162 samples, while FilmArray showed the presence of viruses and/or bacteria in 63 (38.9%) of 162. FilmArray results (28 samples with multiple microorganisms) identified bacteria in 53 (84.1%) of 63 patients and viruses in 22 (34.9%) of 63, as follows: Staphylococcus aureus (25/63, 39.7%), Haemophilus influenzae (15/63, 23.8%), group B streptococci (6/63, 9.5%), influenza A virus (5/63, 7.9%) and influenza B, coronaviruses and rhinoviruses/enteroviruses (each 4/63, 6.3%).
